eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Pepe examines the reanimated Nameless General in the office, while Narantuya proceeds with her kidnapping plan. Medjehtiqedti encounters 'supernatural events' while evacuating the visitors, and the Minoan tourist Aspasia leads the rest of the visitors out of the museum.

attributes.content: Look at the level of detail. This guy could even imitate expressions and mouth movements.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Let me see inside your mouth. Aaah...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: (Opens mouth)
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Hmm. I can see structures resembling vocal cords. So why haven't you said a single thing?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Speech is just movement of the vocal cords and associated muscles. You should be able to emulate it...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe approaches the mummy and places her hand on its throat. The mummy follows her movement, placing its hand on Pepe's throat.
You know...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You... know...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yo... oo... no... oo...
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Pepe draws her hand back, covering her mouth in amazement, wonder in her eyes.
So you CAN speak...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Inconceivable... the artificers of the Shah's time were amazing...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Right. I once read about that in Artifacts of the Old Calendar Era...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: There were those who could seal a consciousness in gems by etching Originium circuits on it, then place it inside a body of gold, allowing it to survive for millennia without decay.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Lost... Zhayedan technologies... the Shahanshah will be very interested...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The trove must be somewhere deep inside your memories.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Just copying me isn't enough. You need to tell me where it is.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Let me see...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: 'First, the heart. At its first beat, we come to be. Second, the lungs. At their first breath, we come to feel.'
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: 'Third, the bowels. We fill them with food, cultivate our tongues, and develop our own likings. Fourth, the liver. We go into the night, awake and alert, for duty and obligation.'
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Fifth...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What came fifth?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The verse ends there...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Looks like the Arsalan researcher never found the answer.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But you'll help me find it, won't you?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: She stretches out her hand and places her fingers on the mummy's throat.
Yes, hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yes, hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: Stop copying me.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Stop copying me.
attributes.name: Nameless Mummy

attributes.content: She moves her hand from the mummy's throat to his hand and shakes it firmly. The mummy shakes her hand back.
I'll take that as a yes to our cooperation.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm here, Ajazi. Why aren't you at the door?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Where are you?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: (Whisper) What do you mean you don't know where you are?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: How am I supposed to go in without a pass...? Why is this office door built like a bloody vault?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: We don't have time, the evacuation's almost done!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Ajazi, is the hall window next to the curator office's window?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Yes, I know it's high.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I'll be careful.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Please be quiet in the museum. Disorder is the enemy of reason.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Do not push. The statues and murals displayed here are not protected by glass cases and can easily be...
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: As I said, this statue was almost damaged. We don't want to see that happen, of course.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: History may lie in the past, but that doesn't mean it's not of our concern. What we almost broke might be the joy of those who conquered the peaks centuries ago, or their mirth as they raised their goblets to one another.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: How enlightening and professional...
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: ...But are you sure you need to keep carrying that statue? Along with everything else you're carrying right now?
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: Yes, I'm bringing it all back to where it belongs.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: You sure take your work seriously, even when the museum is about to close.
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: ...Close?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: They announced about an emergency. Haven't you heard? It really gave us a fright!
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: That bumbling woman who was guiding us couldn't tell left from right, and I mean literally.
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: I do agree that certain affairs at this museum leave much to be desired.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: She brought us to this dump, then disappeared without a trace.
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: I must dissent. This is no dump. It is Minoan—
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: You have no idea how scared we were when we realized we were lost.
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: We'll be trapped in here with all the ghosts, if we don't get out in time!
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: Look at that armor, that altar for live sacrifice...
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: Yeah! That's why I never liked museums...
attributes.name: Nearly Fainting Tourist

attributes.content: Aspasia catches the tourist before his head hits the floor.
Statue, clay jar, and goblet litter the floor, alongside the cannons that the Iberians used to carve open Bolívarian trade.
My dear! Are you alright?!
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: Fainted from a panic attack, I suppose.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I have some smelling salts here that should bring him back to his senses, but I advise you to get him examined thoroughly later.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Aspasia deftly crushes the cotton-wrapped glass tube, and places a wet cotton swab in front of the tourist's nose.
As the tourist comes to his senses, she lifts him up and calmly carries him to the front of the line.
An emergency, you say?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Oh... You sure have strong arms...
attributes.name: Still Light-headed Tourist

attributes.content: Follow me, ladies and gentlemen. I will protect you, if anything happens.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Wow...
attributes.name: Still Light-headed Tourist

attributes.content: *sigh* No more running around like this, alright?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I remember you. You're Lazvar's pet—
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: —Hey, no scratching! I just rescued you from the crowd! The least you could do is let me hug you for a moment or two.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Aww, you are so soft and fluffy. Where did Lazvar get you? I wanted one like you, but he wouldn't tell me what breed you were.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I didn't know why I found you so fascinating, until I realized that you looked like one of those cloudbeast statues from the Age of Shadow.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Say, since the staff are helping the visitors evacuate, and I can't have you running around the place, I'll take you to my workshop and show you the statue that's being restored.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Medjehtiqedti descends several flights of stairs, arriving at the conservation lab.
The air in the room is kept cold and dry to protect its contents. A single incandescent lamp illuminates the spacious room. Her exhales quickly turn to white fog.
The underground floor is dead quiet, the restoration staff being mobilized to help with the evacuation. She sniffs and feels her heart race.
No worries, little guy, here's my table...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Some resin-like, gold-colored substance remains on the table: leftovers from Titi's work—repairing artifacts with Originium Arts.
But the cloudbeast statue on the table is nowhere to be seen.
I-I didn't see any cloudbeasts...
attributes.name: Wandering Staff

attributes.content: A shadow flitted across your forehead just now, an ill omen. I fear you will meet with some misfortune soon.
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: What... are you?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Did you come back to life like that old mummy?!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hey, I didn't fix you so you could run around like Anat's research subject!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: And most certainly not to bring misfortune upon myself!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Did I hear someone scream? What happened?!
attributes.name: Warehouse Custodian

attributes.content: Oh, Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi... What are you doing down here?
attributes.name: Warehouse Custodian

attributes.content: I thought you wouldn't be coming back for a while, with the museum being closed for the day, so I put away the artifacts under restoration...
attributes.name: Warehouse Custodian

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...Never mind. I'm in the mood to put in some overtime today. You can go.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: What? No sign of the visitors evacuating the southeast wing? Izaja was supposed to bring them out!
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: I have to lock the gates! The vice curator gave the emergency shutdown order personally. I don't even want to think about how bad it must be.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Did anyone look inside?
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: Yeah, but they didn't see anyone. Where did Izaja take them?
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Why are you so quiet all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: Listen...
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: To what?
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: The wind.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: A procession of a dozen people walks out the front gate into the sun.
They follow their leader—a woman carrying herself in a serene, dignified manner—in an orderly fashion.
She holds a pale-looking tourist on her shoulder, paying no heed to the wind brushing at her garment and caressing her hair, as though a statue that has stood for many years has come to life.
I feel like I've seen this scene before...
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: ...I know. I've seen that statue plenty of times.
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: There's a statue in that pose?
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Anyway, thank goodness, now I can lock the gates.
attributes.name: Museum Security

attributes.content: Thank you so much. Here's my card. My family runs a gem business, and you will get the VIP treatment, if you ever choose to visit.
attributes.name: Lost Tourist

attributes.content: Come visit us in Yan and let me introduce you to my son! Rather handsome young man, if I do say to myself. My sister also has a daughter who just started working at the Tianshi Bureaus. She's single too, if that's your preference.
attributes.name: Passionate Tourist

attributes.content: Thank you, but there is no need... I simply did what I must...
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Aspasia turns around with a start.
The roll-up door is being pulled down, and security guards set up a sign that says 'Closed' in front of it.
Where's my goblet? And my clay jar and statue!
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Where did Nana go? It's getting late.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: She's not at the guava and berry shop, or the enamel and porcelain shop, and not even her favorite celestine-laminated pipes...
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: What a waste of time. I tell you, that cloudbeast must have been eaten by that rampaging zombie at the museum.
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Oh no! How horrible!
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: It's just a pet. I'll buy you another. In fact, I'll buy you anything you want!
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Never mind the gems—I'll buy you the entire gem trading post!
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: (Raises head)
attributes.name: Mysterious Animal

attributes.content: Is that a yes?
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: No, look at your feet...
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: (Glares)
attributes.name: Mysterious Animal

attributes.content: Pah, Lazvar's cur.
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Ahem. Oh, hello there, Lazvar. I didn't see you.
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Good timing. Let's do some business. My girl is very interested in this gem trading post.
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Wait, I never said that...
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: I have a mobile platform in east Sargon that includes extensive Originium refineries, dye factories, food processing plants...
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: I'll throw some gold and jewels on top of it. That should get the deal done, shouldn't it?
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: No, thank you, I'm not interested.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: The weight of this trading post is too much for you to understand.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Weight, huh... if nothing else, you've inherited your grandfather's arrogance.
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: A word of advice. Either keep a few fierce manglers to intimidate people like he did...
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Or have your little cloudbeast greet VIPs like me. At least it knows when to grovel...
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Ouch! Y-You bit me?
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: (Bares teeth)
attributes.name: Mysterious Animal

attributes.content: Woof!
attributes.name: Mysterious Animal

attributes.content: No! Stay away from me! Help—!
attributes.name: Extravagant Man

attributes.content: Woof woof woof!
attributes.name: Mysterious Animal

attributes.content: That will do, Woof.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: He's gone.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Woof!
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: You want me to pet you? Let's see... here?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: (Licks happily)
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: A fowlbeast flies over and perches on the shoulder of the young trading post overseer's shoulder.
The overseer fiddles with the metal fowlbeast's mechanisms, turns its coil spring, and lets it fly.
He's getting increasingly active.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: I'm sure you're looking forward to seeing him as I am. Mio doesn't often go out alone like this.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Maybe the man was right. I should have my cloudbeast greet important guests.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: Hm... could Mio really bring him over?
attributes.name: Lazvar
